body:
hi @seanbyrne226 numpy arrays are [n_cases][n_dimensions][series_length], so this seems to be trying to create an array with 38 instances, 38 dimensions and series length 1 or 2. Could you post the code you used to generate the data, assuming its simulated? 
>ValueError: cannot reshape array of size 38 into shape (38,38,1)

Hi Tony, Thanks for the quick reply, Unfortunately it's not simulated and there is a lot of preprocessing, I will try and make an MRE now but it may not be so easy. I think the cause of the problem comes from this section if it is any help I've tried to comment so that it is but if you need more just ask and thanks for the help :) ### Make a truncator: models work on untruncated data using df_train, df_test. ### My patch for bug : (https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/2999) trunc_df_total = pd.concat([df_train, df_val, df_test], axis=0) reg_df_total = pd.concat([df_train, df_val, df_test], axis=0) check_raise(trunc_df_total,mtype="pd-multiindex") # Returns true from sktime.transformations.panel.truncation import TruncationTransformer trunc = TruncationTransformer(lower=1000, upper=6000) # To test set values 0-2 then call .head() trunc_df = trunc.fit_transform(trunc_df_total) trunc_df.reset_index() x1 = trunc_df.index.get_level_values(0).unique() y1 = reg_df_total.index.get_level_values(0).unique() trunc_df = trunc_df.rename(index=dict(zip(x1,y1)), level=0 ) ### re-split trunc_df_train = trunc_df.loc[trunc_df.index.get_level_values(0).isin(train)] trunc_df_val = trunc_df.loc[trunc_df.index.get_level_values(0).isin(val)] trunc_df_test = trunc_df.loc[trunc_df.index.get_level_values(0).isin(test)] check_raise(trunc_df_train,mtype="pd-multiindex") # Returns true` And here is a view of the data:

I confess I have never used pd-multiindex so may not be much help, but I will have a go :) What are the shapes of df_train, df_val and df_test used here? Are they storing Series in nested_univ format? 
trunc_df_total = pd.concat([df_train, df_val, df_test], axis=0)
Thanks, and no they are just columns with a single float entry at each row. I will try to convert the multi-index to 3d_numpy at the very start of my pipeline and see if that changes anything.
if the series are equal length its always easier to get them into numpy 3D shape [n_cases][n_dimensions][series_length]

@seanbyrne226, it would be great if you could paste self-contained code that reproduces the bug.
You could use `datatypes.get_examples`, or `sktime.utils._testing.panel._make_panel` to create dummy data.

This works: 
```python

from sktime.datatypes import get_examples
train_df = get_examples(mtype="pd-multiindex", as_scitype="Panel")[0]
test_df = get_examples(mtype="pd-multiindex", as_scitype="Panel")[0]
print(check_raise(train_df,mtype="pd-multiindex"))

# Make a truncator:
from sktime.transformations.panel.truncation import TruncationTransformer
trunc = TruncationTransformer(lower=1, upper=3) # set bouns ie 5 secs starting from second 2. To test set values 0-2 then call head
trunc_df_train = trunc.fit_transform(train_df)
trunc_df_test = trunc.fit_transform(test_df)
print(trunc_df_train.index)
print(trunc_df_train.shape)
print(trunc_df_train.head(10))

# labels 
data = [10,30,60]
train_labels = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['score'])
test_labels = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['score']) # just to make clear
print(train_labels['score'].shape)
print(train_labels['score'])

X_train, y_train = trunc_df_train , train_labels['score']
X_test, y_test = trunc_df_test , test_labels['score']
print(X_train.shape, y_train.shape, X_test.shape, y_test.shape )

from sktime.classification.distance_based import KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier
classifier = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier(distance="euclidean" , n_jobs=-1)
pipe = make_pipeline(classifier)
pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
```

With the output:
True

But then with my data using what I think is identical code it kills the index, and but also when it runs I encounter:

```python
train_df = df_man
test_df = df_woman
print(check_raise(train_df,mtype="pd-multiindex"))

# Make a truncator:
from sktime.transformations.panel.truncation import TruncationTransformer
trunc = TruncationTransformer(lower=1, upper=3) # set bouns ie 5 secs starting from second 2. To test set values 0-2 then call head
trunc_df_train = trunc.fit_transform(train_df)
trunc_df_test = trunc.fit_transform(test_df)
print(trunc_df_train.index)
print(trunc_df_train.shape)
print(trunc_df_train.head(10))

# labels 
train_labels = total_labels['man']
test_labels = total_labels['woman']
print(train_labels.shape)
print(train_labels)

X_train, y_train = trunc_df_train , train_labels
X_test, y_test = trunc_df_test , test_labels
print(X_train.shape, y_train.shape, X_test.shape, y_test.shape )

from sktime.classification.distance_based import KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier
classifier = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier(distance="euclidean" , n_jobs=-1)
pipe = make_pipeline(classifier)
pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
```

ValueError: cannot reshape array of size 152 into shape (38,76,2)

Apologies if this is something dumb I am doing.

@seanbyrne226, thanks!
Could you present the bug in a single, minimal code block?

Preferably in a python fenced code block
https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/fenced_code_blocks/#language
(use `python` instead of `html`)
@fkiraly  I edited the output to what I think you mean, thanks

> @fkiraly I edited the output to what I think you mean, thanks

Thanks!

Just to clarify: I would like to have a block of code that I can copy-paste, it runs without any additional imports, and that breaks - so we can debug.

The top code block (which I briefly reformatted) has missing imports (e.g., `pd` is not imported), and it seems to run without bug.

These code blocks run without problem for me (python 3.8.12, windows)

```python
import pandas as pd

from sktime.datatypes import get_examples
from sktime.transformations.panel.truncation import TruncationTransformer

train_df = get_examples(mtype="pd-multiindex", as_scitype="Panel")[0]
test_df = get_examples(mtype="pd-multiindex", as_scitype="Panel")[0]

# Make a truncator:
trunc = TruncationTransformer(lower=1, upper=3) # set bouns ie 5 secs starting from second 2. To test set values 0-2 then call head
trunc_df_train = trunc.fit_transform(train_df)
trunc_df_test = trunc.fit_transform(test_df)

# labels 
data = [10,30,60]
train_labels = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['score'])
test_labels = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['score']) # just to make clear

X_train, y_train = trunc_df_train , train_labels['score']
X_test, y_test = trunc_df_test , test_labels['score']
```

```python
from sktime.classification.distance_based import KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier
from sktime.pipeline import make_pipeline

classifier = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier(distance="euclidean" , n_jobs=-1)
pipe = make_pipeline(classifier)
pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
```
Yes I got it working for the top too but not the bottom. I guess the problem is within my preprocessing and not SKtime itself, thanks for the help :)
Hm, still would be interested to see your breaking example. Perhaps there's something to learn, e.g., automatic coercion, or a genuine `sktime` bug.

I have a deadline for presenting the results on Friday, after that I'll try and post here what went wrong with the pipeline if its easy enough to debug. The workaround was to start over the data and use 3d numpy arrays over pandas multiindex.

So my solution to this problem was to convert my multi-index to a 3d_numpy myself using the following code to get the  numpy 3D shape [n_cases][n_dimensions][series_length] as so:

        # Convert to 3d np arr:

        tmp = df.unstack().stack(level=1)

       arr = np.array(
            [tmp.xs(i).to_numpy() for i in df.index.unique("n_cases")]
        )

Which I believe gives a different  shape than what happens when sktime converts the multi-index that I belive is giving me the shape numpy 3D shape [n_cases][series_length][n_dimensions].
could you give the full code?
